item.title: In Other News: Controversial Ransomware Report, Gootloader Returns, More AN0M Arrests
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Other noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: rogue ransomware negotiators charged, F5 hack prompts OT security guidance, Germany targets Huawei tech.

The post In Other News: Controversial Ransomware Report, Gootloader Returns, More AN0M Arrests appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Landfall Android Spyware Targeted Samsung Phones via Zero-Day
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Threat actors exploited CVE-2025-21042 to deliver malware via specially crafted images to users in the Middle East. 

The post Landfall Android Spyware Targeted Samsung Phones via Zero-Day appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Radical Empowerment From Your Leadership: Understood by Few, Essential for All
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Leggio
item.description:
When leaders redefine power as trust instead of control, teams unlock their potential — and organizations find their edge.

The post Radical Empowerment From Your Leadership: Understood by Few, Essential for All appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Data Exposure Vulnerability Found in Deep Learning Tool Keras
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The vulnerability is tracked as CVE-2025-12058 and it can be exploited for arbitrary file loading and conducting SSRF attacks.

The post Data Exposure Vulnerability Found in Deep Learning Tool Keras appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: ClickFix Attacks Against macOS Users Evolving
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
ClickFix prompts typically contain instructions for Windows users, but now they are tailored for macOS and they are getting increasingly convincing.

The post ClickFix Attacks Against macOS Users Evolving appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: DOJ Antitrust Review Clears Google’s $32 Billion Acquisition of Wiz
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Google’s acquisition of Wiz is expected to close in 2026, but there are other reviews that need to be cleared.

The post DOJ Antitrust Review Clears Google’s $32 Billion Acquisition of Wiz appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Congressional Budget Office Was Hacked. It Says It Has Implemented New Security Measures
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
The Congressional Budget Office confirmed it had been hacked, potentially disclosing important government data to malicious actors.

The post The Congressional Budget Office Was Hacked. It Says It Has Implemented New Security Measures appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Chrome 142 Update Patches High-Severity Flaws
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
An out-of-bounds write flaw in WebGPU tracked as CVE-2025-12725 could be exploited for remote code execution.

The post Chrome 142 Update Patches High-Severity Flaws appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Destructive Russian Cyberattacks on Ukraine Expand to Grain Sector
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Multiple state-sponsored Russian groups are targeting Ukrainian entities and European countries linked to Ukraine.

The post Destructive Russian Cyberattacks on Ukraine Expand to Grain Sector appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 18 Arrested in Crackdown on Credit Card Fraud Rings
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Between 2016 and 2021, the suspects defrauded 4.3 million cardholders in 193 countries of €300 million (~$346 million).

The post 18 Arrested in Crackdown on Credit Card Fraud Rings appeared first on SecurityWeek.
